title: Geodynamics
description: Quantitative discussion of dynamic processs in the solid Earth; lithospheric dynamics, continuum mechanics, lithospheric flexure and elasticity, heat transfer, viscous rheology, fluid mechanics, and earthquake dynamics.  Credit not allowed for both EAS 4312 and EAS 6312.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: EAS 3610 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D
